page.title: 03HOUSING IN BISHOPS LYDEARD
page.content: Housing in the village is in four seperate sections.The original village is mostly built of the local soft red sandstone and contains some houses parts of which are mediaeval in origin.South of the centre is the Greenway Estate of 139 houses built after the Second World War replacing service huts which had been occupied by squatters.About the same time north of the centre of the village the Darby Way Estate of 163 houses was built.In 1975 after an intensive drainage scheme the Hither Mead Estate of 425 private houses was built to the east of the centre of the village. Proposals have been made to build to the west of the village but so far these have been rejected.
